page.title: 19St. John's Church, Ingleton
page.content: {St. John's Church }was consecrated by the Bishop of Durham on October 31,1844. Farmers in the district led the stone to build the church. The church is light and well_kept with a cheery red carpet and gleaming brass. Above the Altar is a stained- glass window in memory of Rev.J.M. Shepherd, the{Vicar}of Ingleton from 1874 to 1910. There is a bell turret and an entrance porch at the west end of the church. To the south of the church is the burial ground. The{Rev. N. Burt}has been Vicar of Ingleton since 1976, he lives in the{ {Vicarage}which was built in 1851.
